title: UDL-Based Collaborative Learning Design for Inclusive Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic language education theory and practical experience, with foundational understanding of inclusive education concepts
context.additional_context: Utilizing smartphone-based collaboration tools, strengthening peer teaching among learners, and analyzing parent/peer collaboration case studies.

learning_goals: Learners can propose at least three strategies reflecting diverse learner needs when designing language education activities that apply Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles
Learners can develop role distribution and communication protocols for creating inclusive environments during collaborative learning projects
Learners can analyze cases of diversity respect in language education settings and develop educational plans incorporating social-emotional learning goals based on these analyses

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
